alert.note: Alert for Polk (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 5:57AM CDT until July 14 at 7:55AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Polk County in western Arkansas... * Until 755 AM CDT. * At 557 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wickes, Grannis, Hatfield, Vandervoort, Cossatot River State Park, Hartley, Mccauley, Shady, Caney Creek Wilderness, Bard Springs Recreation Area, Cove, Big Fork, Hatton, Bogg Springs, Shady Lake Recreation Area and Roaring Branch Natural Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
